data.title: Update extension button invisible when new version number too big

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
If the number is too big and the side bar too small, the button to upgrade vanishes from view (but still covers the author's name).

In this example, the button is gone only when I'm using a theme with borders around the side bar, like the High Contrast or Dracula. With a theme without borders, the space is just right to fit the example "0.29.0", both using minimal side bar width.


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9814055/30133791-7af78d12-932b-11e7-9ac2-af2747075b4e.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9814055/30133526-9b0c4fe4-932a-11e7-8e9a-54bb86827a24.png)

data.title: 'Extension not found' when trying to install 1.16 extension in 1.15

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T17:15:57.756Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: Many

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Publish an extension depending on VSCode 1.16
2. Installing from the extensions viewlet into 1.16-insiders works fine
3. Installing from the extensions viewlet into 1.15 fails with an error 'Extension not found'

The expected behavior is to either filter extension depending on a newer version from the extensions viewlet or display an appropriate info message when trying to install such an extension.

data.title: Provide "Go Last" navigation command.
data.body: @bpasero requested over in PR #33715 that I create this issue. My goal is to implement a pair of related Vim "jump to mark" commands: https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/pull/1993 As far as I can tell, VSCode does not currently offer "marks" ("bookmarks"), but does have back/forward navigation history. In Vim, when you "jump" (navigate) anywhere, the specially named `'` and \` "last jump" marks are set each time. The first time you press `''` or ``, the experience is indistinguishable from "Navigate Back". However, that navigation is itself a jump, setting the special last jump marks. That means, if you press the key sequences again, you jump back to where you just came from. So pressing `''` over and over will flip back and forth between two places. The ' register marks a line and the \` register marks a full position. The former can be implemented in terms of the latter. While Vim implements this behavior in terms of marks, it's equally valid to implement it in terms of jumps, since the navigation history inherently includes cursor position information (ie anonymous marks). All that's necessary is a single variable storing one layer of additional navigation history: The last place you came from. In practice, this feature works out something like alternating between "Go Back" and "Go Forward", letting you flip between to places quickly to compare them. This is frequently useful when comparing two places in one file, or when comparing places between files. Side-by-side comparisons are useful, but require more window manipulation to set up and tear down. "Go Last" enables quick overlay comparisons like flipping pages of a book back and forth.

data.title: Formatting document breakes indentation for multilined parameters in functions chain
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: macOs 10.12.6

When you have a function and trying to call it with parameters going one-per-line, the indentation is fine after document formatting:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8117458/30120930-e6b6bd1e-9332-11e7-8214-680c8d0e35ad.png)

But if you try to format document with a function chain and multilined parameters, they will lost the indentation relatively to parent level:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8117458/30121165-9e033218-9333-11e7-9cbb-d8eaeb61c231.png)

data.title: Indentation based code folding regions have unexpected behavior with multi-line string literal.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T17:16:27.618Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-81-generic
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16
yaml|ada|0.0.8
npm-intellisense|chr|1.3.0
jshint|dba|0.10.15
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
githistory|don|0.2.3
python|don|0.7.0
gitlens|eam|4.4.3
vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.1
ansible|haa|0.2.5
vscode-git-tags|how|1.1.0
vscode-todo-parser|min|1.9.1
prettify-json|moh|0.0.3
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.1
chai-snippets|nwh|0.1.0
vscode-icons|rob|7.12.0
es6-mocha-snippets|spo|0.0.2
shellcheck|tim|0.1.0
vscode-todo-highlight|way|0.5.11
JavaScriptSnippets|xab|1.4.1



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Given the following code block
```
describe('hahahaa', function(){
    const text= `
---
hahaha
one more
`;
    it('nest me', function(){
        const test = 'this is';
    });
});
describe('different block', function(){
    console.log('hahahah');
});
```
2. The backtick'd literal appears to throw off function/block collapsing/folding . Folding hyphens appear at lines:
 1 - "describe('haha.."                         # Collapses only lines 1 - 2
 6 - "`;"                                                # Collapses lines 6 - 9
 7 - "      it(('nest...."                             # Collapses lines 7 - 8
11 - "describe('diff...'"                          # Collapses lines 11 -12

3. The behavior for the folds on lines 1 and 6 is correct from the 'based on the indentation of lines' description of the implementation - but annoying for some humans ('the variable on line 2 is OBVIOUSLY a multi-line template literal, so why doesn't the editor know this and why does it hate me :(')

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Create File overwrites existing files without warning
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.17.0-insider (be71eecef0bff8ad4a84ce06cd54b9185bc8c306, 2017-09-06T05:15:43.568Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-93-generic
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-markdownlint|Dav|0.10.0
xml|Dot|1.9.2
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16
django-html|bib|1.2.0
django-snippets|bib|1.1.0
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
gitignore|cod|0.5.0
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
githistory|don|0.2.3
jupyter|don|1.1.3
python|don|0.7.0
python-extension-pack|don|1.0.0
MagicPython|mag|1.0.12
cpptools|ms-|0.12.3
csharp|ms-|1.12.1
vscode-icons|rob|7.12.0
perltidy|sfo|1.2.1
vim|vsc|0.10.0
gitblame|wad|2.1.0
jinja|who|0.0.8

(2 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a file externally for example use the integrated terminal and do "wget https://wowsocool.domain.tld/supersecretpath/veryimportant.file.ext"
2. see that the file browser does not recognize the new file that was created.
3. click on create file and enter the filename of the existing file
4. ????
5. Profit! Your file has been truncated.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No

This is weird. It seems that one of the extensions is preventing the folder to be re-scanned and updated.
But even though it is a bug that the file gets truncated if it already exists. Even if it would correctly update it would still be racy and that is bad. I guess this bug is rather low prio but it should be relative easy to fix tbh.

data.title: Emmet Abbreviations in Css with - doesn't trigger Emmet suggestions
data.body:
From @LukeMcGurdy in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/33764#issuecomment-327418928

- In a css file, run the command `Emmet: Expand Abbreviation` after `p10-20` 
- It expands to `padding: 10px 20px;`
- Same doesn't show up in the suggestion list

data.title: DNF doesn't pick up the latest package version
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: code-1.14.2-1500507068.el7.x86_64
- OS Version: Fedora 26 - 4.12.9-300.fc26.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri Aug 25 13:09:43 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install the package code-1.14.2-1500507068.el7.x86_64
2. Follow steps on https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/setup/linux#_rhel-fedora-and-centos-based-distributions to add the vscode repository.
3. Install vscode: 
```
$ sudo dnf install code
```
The message shown is:
```
Last metadata expiration check: 0:00:27 ago on Wed 06 Sep 2017 10:09:01 AM EDT.
Package code-1.14.2-1500507068.el7.x86_64 is already installed, skipping.
Dependencies resolved.
Nothing to do.
Complete!
```


The package code-1.15.1-1502904099.el7.x86_64 is in the repository but the DNF command doesn't recognize as the latest package. To overcome this issue I had to install the package directly like:
```
sudo dnf install https://packages.microsoft.com/yumrepos/vscode/code-1.15.1-1502904099.el7.x86_64.rpm
```

data.title: Emmet not working properly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 32-bit

I have installed no extension yet on my new install of VSCode. I am not able to use emmet properly.
Eg.
1. Open any empty html file
2. Type `app-navbar`
3. Press Tab.

In version 1.10 and some other later versions, when we do the same the `app-navbar` expanded to `<app-navbar></app-navbar>`. But in this version 1.15.1 I am not able to expand that abbreviation.

data.title: Installer is signed, extracted exe is not
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 1607

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Apply applocker policies which denies anything not signed and allows signed exe-files
2. Run VSCode install
3. Get this message in AppLocker log:
"%OSDRIVE%\USERS\USERNAME\APPDATA\LOCAL\TEMP\IS-A02HI.TMP\VSCODESETUP-X64-1.15.1.TMP was prevented from running."

Turns out that the exe-file you download is signed but the one which is extracted and run, is not.

data.title: Feature Request : Toolbar Styles ( Especially for Linux)
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Elementary OS Loki 0.4.1

Here's how current vscode toolbar looks on my desktop.
![vscode](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12745166/30113724-dc14486a-933f-11e7-9750-fcd3bbdbfaaf.png)

I am sure we can make it more stylish and bind with theme color, like shown here : 
![image](https://imgur.com/eQt9Z1u.png)
I took this image from https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=whizkydee.material-palenight-theme . It is probably running on Windows machine.

But I am sure, we can also make the toolbar stylish in linux,
This is [Gravit Designer](https://designer.io) app (also based on electron) running on my linux machine. *Note the toolbar.
![gravit](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12745166/30113927-73359618-9340-11e7-8fa3-08352f79fc83.png)

So, I think it's very possible to implement that on linux machine too.

data.title: Very weird color in default Solarized Dark theme ever since some startup
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.16.0-insider (1.16.0-insider)
- OS Version: 10.12.6 (16G29)

Steps to Reproduce: 

1. Start the app "vscode" or "vscode-insiders"

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

![vscode-solarized-dark](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5665980/30112757-04f31f90-9345-11e7-9c3c-034f6f9e6fdd.png)

![screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5665980/30112764-0aaff0c0-9345-11e7-88c9-b66f3c96bb5c.png)

The color of the default theme is very weird ever since some startup. Before that startup of the app, it looks like the above. Now it becomes very greenish in the below.

I experienced the exactly same problem in another app "Hyper" (a terminal app) as well. Since both Hyper and Vscode are using electron, I`m wondering if this is an issue of electron?

Meanwhile, all the other colorschemes are fine.

Please help me to fix this weird color problem. Many thanks!

data.title: MacOS VSCode and keypress to get accent print double character
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.15.1 (1.15.1)
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use VSCode (latest version) on macOS with non accent keyboard layout. eg: US
2. Press key "e" and maintain to get OSx accentuated characters suggestion. Press the desired number to get accentuated letter.
3. The letter without accent is printed followed by the accentuated one instead of replacing the first one with accentuated.

**Please note** this behavior is not encountered in other editors or in browser for example. Nor encountered in slack app desktop. Just in VS Code.

**It's note encounted in the search input (CMD + F).**

**Please also note** this behavior is not new and was encountered before june.

Here is a gif:

![sep-06-2017 07-46-46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11064123/30110461-2b513f22-92d8-11e7-9b7a-a53d6e636894.gif)

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Not possible to disable error highlighting in VS Code
data.body:
I couldn't get an answer on [SO](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46061857/how-to-disable-error-highlighting-in-vs-code) so I ask / report my problem here:
 
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: MacOS 10.12.6

I can't disable the error highlighting in java files. There seems to be no setting to disable the highlighting of errors/warning. I need to disable error highlighting in Java files in VS Code. VS Code tries to check a Groovy file while thinking it is a Java file (which is intended).

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: <pre> breaks Markdown Coloring
data.body:
It appears that when using a combination of `
` and `` it breaks any sort of markdown related coloration that comes even after both tags are closed. For example, headers will now display as the same color as the text that falls under them. (Screenshot at bottom)

Using these tags is necessary for mark down to recognize other tags (such as ) within the code block. Using ` ``` `or the indentation technique results in those tags becoming plain text instead. It appears the main problem is with the `
` tag, rather than ``.

- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 1703

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create Headers.
2. Create Text Below Headers.
3. Create Code Block using `
`, and input text.
4. Close Code Block using `
`.
5. Reproduces without extensions: Yes
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28165449/30109058-def290fe-92d2-11e7-9917-983ffecc691b.png)

data.title: selectionHighlight still slow and blocking for long non-wrapped lines
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T18:07:25.676Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
---

## Steps to Reproduce:

1. Save `https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/f/fd/Ghostscript_Tiger.svg` and open in VSC.
2. Ensure settings `"editor.selectionHighlight": true` <ins datetime="2017-09-12T14:18:59+02">and `"editor.fontLigatures": true`</ins>
3. Select entire document.
4. Invoke `>Join Lines`.
5. If lines are wrapped, invoke `>Toggle word wrap` .
6. Select `0` (zero, or any other digit).

## Actual behavior:

Editor **completely frozen** (i.e. does not react for any kind of input) **for circa 15 seconds**.
After highlights appear editor works normally again.

## Expected behavior: 

No freeze.
Would not mind missing or delayed highlights.

## Notes:

Quite OK with wrapped lines.
Older (closed) issues relevant to this "long lines" topic: #31425 #6885 #13515 

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: quick fix: select first entry in menu automatically for fast access
data.body: fixes #13631
